page.title: 10LOCAL HISTORY.PICNIC AREA.
page.content: FARTHING COMMON is said by some to be named so because it is so small that it could never have been worth more than a farthing to any commoner;others say its size is only the forth part, four-thing, of any useful plot. It is 595ft above sea level on the Stone Street Road to Canterbury and is now a picnic area. Many people stop to admire the views of the countryside. Stone Street passes due north and south through this area. It is the old roman road which leads from Port Lympne to Canterbury and the junction with Watling Street.
